programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Rangers raise their 2023 World Series banner prior to hosting the Cubs. Texas defeated Arizona in five games to win its first championship. Chicago owns the most Opening Day victories with 81. Nathan Eovaldi takes the ball for the Rangers.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: The Rangers raise their 2023 World Series banner prior to hosting the Cubs. Texas defeated Arizona in five games to win its first championship. Chicago owns the most Opening Day victories with 81. Nathan Eovaldi takes the ball for the Rangers.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NCAA Women's Basketball Championship Studio
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts discuss the NCAA women's basketball tournament.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 3 Beavers face the No. 2 Fighting Irish in the NCAA Tournament Sweet 16. Maddy Westbeld's 20 points pushed Notre Dame past Ole Miss in round two. Westbeld had 11 points in a 64-62 win over Oregon State in the 2021 Daytona Beach Invitational.

programme.title: NCAA Women's Basketball Championship Studio
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts discuss the NCAA women's basketball tournament.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gamecocks (34-0) draw the No. 4 Hoosiers (26-5) in the NCAA Tournament's Sweet 16. Indiana's 71-57 victory over South Carolina on Nov. 28, 2019, was the Gamecocks' only loss of that season and its ninth-most recent defeat overall.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: ESPN basketball analysts discuss upcoming NCAA Tournament games.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 2 Cardinal and No. 3 Wolfpack collide in the NCAA Tournament's Sweet 16. NC State seeks its second trip to the Elite Eight in three years. Stanford held off Iowa State in overtime in the second round, while NC State ousted Tennessee.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: ESPN basketball analysts discuss upcoming NCAA Tournament games.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 4 Bulldogs run into the No. 1 Longhorns during the NCAA Tournament's Sweet 16. Gonzaga twins Kayleigh and Kaylynne Truong combined for 35 points with seven 3-pointers to file away No. 5 Utah in the second round. Texas has won six in a row.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: ESPN FC
programme.desc: Highlights, news, reactions and opinions from the day in soccer.

programme.title: Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: FC Bayern München contests Borussia Dortmund at Allianz Arena in matchround 27 of the Bundesliga. Dortmund has lost nine consecutive Bundesliga away fixtures against FC Bayern (by an aggregate score of 37-8), since a 3-0 victory on April 12, 2014.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Angel City FC try for their first win of the new campaign when they visit the Kansas City Current. Kansas City is the highest-scoring club early in the NWSL season, with seven goals through a pair of victories. Angel City won both meetings in 2023.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: JuJu Watkins leads the No. 1 Trojans into an NCAA Tournament Sweet 16 matchup against the No. 5 Bears. Watkins, a 6-foot-2 freshman guard, has racked up 51 points and nine assists to guide USC to a pair of lopsided tournament victories.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: ESPN basketball analysts discuss upcoming NCAA Tournament games.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 7 Blue Devils face the No. 3 Huskies in the NCAA Tournament's Sweet 16. UConn has won 10 straight meetings, including 72-59 in the 2018 NCAA regional semifinals. UConn star Paige Bueckers is averaging 30 points through two tournament outings.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Blanchfield vs. Fiorot
programme.desc: Nursulton Ruziboev vs. Sedriques Dumas, middleweight; Chris Weidman vs. Bruno Silva, middleweight; Vicente Luque vs. Joaquin Buckley, welterweight; Erin Blanchfield vs. Manon Fiorot, flyweight. From Boardwalk Hall in Atlantic City, N.J.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: From the Alamodome in San Antonio.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: From Rice Stadium in Houston.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Dodgers and Cardinals conclude their four-game series on Sunday Night Baseball. St. Louis left-hander Steven Matz opposes rookie righty Gavin Stone. Matz, who won a career-high 14 games with Toronto in 2021, is 54-58 with a 4.25 ERA lifetime.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: From Baum Stadium in Fayetteville, Ark.

programme.title: My Name is Dany Garcia
programme.desc: This ESPN documentary examines the life of Dany Garcia, the first female owner of a major sports league, just as spring pro football evolves again with the UFL's debut this weekend.

programme.title: The Climb: LSU Gymnastics
programme.desc: An in-depth look at the LSU gymnastics program.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: A first of its kind medical procedure kept her alive, but it was a promise to run again with her hero that gave her hope.

programme.title: Candace Parker: Unapologetic
programme.desc: A wide-ranging, revealing, and often intimate portrait of WNBA player Candace Parker, one of the most transcendent women's sports stars in history.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Talk That Talk: Seniesa vs. Valle
programme.desc: Pre-fight discussion from boxers Seniesa Estrada and Yokasta Valle, who will fight for the undisputed WBA and WBC minimumweight crowns on March 29.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback
programme.desc: Enhanced replay of Silva vs. Weidman I.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.desc: The Nuggets resume their quest for the top seed in the West by hosting the Cavaliers. Cleveland won the first meeting this season 121-109, with Darius Garland notching 26 points and six assists. The Cavaliers look to halt a three-game road slide.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Warriors wrap up a five-game trip by trying to win the season series versus the Spurs. Golden State has won two of three 2023-24 meetings after a 112-102 triumph on March 11 behind 19 points, nine rebounds and eight assists by Chris Paul.
